added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2014-04-08 22:07+0000\n" "PO-Revision-Date: 2014-04-08 22:08+0000\n""href=\"https://github.com/stackforge/openstack-chef-" "repo\">https://github.com/stackforge/openstack-chef-repo. Additional "#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_customize.xml855(title)msgid "User-Facing Operations""reference for users, but as an operator you should have a basic " "understanding of how to use the cloud facilities. This chapter looks at " "OpenStack from a basic user perspective, which helps you understand your " "users' needs and determine, when you get a trouble ticket, whether it is a "#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml880(para)"Images can also be standard installation media such as ISO images. " "Essentially, they contain bootable file systems that are used to launch " "instances.""Several premade images exist and can easily be imported into the Image "" for working with your image. For example, the min-disk option " "is useful for images that require root disks of a certain size (for example," " large Windows images). To view these options, do:""entire image into the Image Service, but references an original location " "where the image can be found. Upon launching an instance of that image, the " "Image Service accesses the image from the location specified.""thing is done when using the STDIN redirection with < such as shown in " "the example.""In a multitenant cloud environment, users sometimes want to share their " "personal images or snapshots with other projects. This can be done on the " "command line with the tool by the owner of the image.""Unfortunately, nonadmin users are unable to use the command" " to do this. The easiest solution is to obtain the UUID either from an "#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml539(para) #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml560(para) #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml580(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml95(para)"Deleting an image does not affect instances or snapshots that were based on " "the image."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml100(title)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml101(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml103(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml109(title)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml110(para)"The only thing that the Image Service does not store in a database is the " "image itself. The Image Service database has two main tables:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml115(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml118(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml121(para)"custom lists and reports of images. Technically, you can update properties " "about images through the database, although this is not generally " "recommended."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml128(title)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml129(para)"the owner. This example goes one step further and displays the readable name"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml138(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml145(title)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml146(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml162(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml164(para)" of what type of virtual machine to run—just like they would have if they " "were purchasing a physical server. The table lists the elements that can be " "set. Note in particular extra_specs, which can be used to" " define free-form characteristics, giving a lot of flexibility beyond just " "the size of RAM, CPU, and Disk." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml172(caption) msgid "Flavor Parameters"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml153(th) #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml495(td)msgid "A unique numeric ID.""A descriptive name, such as xx.size_name, is conventional but not required, ""Optional property that allows created servers to have a different bandwidth " "cap from that defined in the network they are attached to. This factor is ""Boolean value that indicates whether the flavor is available to all users or" " private. Private flavors do not get the current tenant assigned to them. " "Defaults to True.""on. This is implemented as key-value pairs that must match against the " "corresponding key-value pairs on compute nodes. Can be used to implement " "things like special resources (such as flavors that can run only on compute ""This helps you easily identify which flavors are custom, private, and public" " for the entire cloud."msgid "How Do I Modify an Existing Flavor?"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml292(para) msgid "Security Groups""have a \"default\" security group, which is applied to instances that have "" defaults to true) globally controls whether the rules apply to hosts that " "share a network. When set to true, hosts on the same subnet are not filtered" " and are allowed to pass all types of traffic between them. On a flat " "network, this allows all instances from all projects unfiltered ""false, security groups are enforced for all connections. In this case, it is" " possible for projects to simulate allow_same_net_traffic by " "configuring their default security group to allow all traffic from their ""As noted in the previous chapter, the number of rules per security group is ""dashboard under Access & Security. To see details " "of an existing group, select the edit action for that " "security group. Obviously, modifying existing groups can be done from this " "edit interface. There is a Create Security " "Group button on the main Access & " "Security page for creating new groups. We discuss the terms used " "in these fields when we explain the command line equivalents."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml378(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml387(para)"column is the IP protocol (one of icmp, tcp, or udp), and the second and " "third columns specify the affected port range. The fourth column specifies " "the IP range in CIDR format. This example shows the full port range for all "#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml393(para)"\"bobs_group\" or \"secgrp1.\""#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml399(para)"anywhere on the Internet. We'll call this group \"global_http,\" which is " "clear and reasonably concise, encapsulating what is allowed and from where. " "From the command line, do:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml411(para)"This creates the empty security group. To make it do what we want we need to" " add some rules."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml420(para)"Note that the arguments are positional, and the \"from-port\" and \"to-" "port\" arguments specify the allowed local port range connections. These " "arguments are not indicating source and destination ports of the connection." " More complex rule sets can be built up through multiple invocations of " ". For example, if you want to pass both http and https " "traffic, do this:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml433(para)"Despite only outputting the newly added rule, this operation is additive:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml442(para)"The inverse operation is called , using the same format. " "Whole security groups can be removed with ."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml445(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml447(para)"sources. The user specifies a SourceGroup (security group name) and then all" " the users' other instances using the specified SourceGroup are selected "#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml452(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml454(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml461(title)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml621(glossterm)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml462(para)"OpenStack volumes are persistent block-storage devices that may be attached " "and detached from instances, but they can be attached to only one instance " "at a time. Similar to an external hard drive, they do not provide shared " "storage in the way a network file system or object store does. It is left to" " the operating system in the instance to put a file system on the block " "device and mount it, or not."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml469(para)"As with other removable disk technology, it is important that the operating ""the volume. The OpenStack volume service cannot tell whether it is safe to " "remove volumes from an instance, so it does what it is told. If a user tells" " the volume service to detach a volume from an instance while it is being " "written to, you can expect some level of file system corruption as well as " "faults from whatever process within the instance was using the device."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml480(para)"There is nothing OpenStack-specific in being aware of the steps needed to " "access block devices from within the instance operating system, potentially " "formatting them for first use and being cautious when removing them. What is" " specific is how to create new volumes and attach and detach them from " "instances. These operations can all be done from the " "Volumes page of the dashboard or by using the " " command-line client.""To add new volumes, you need only a name and a volume size in gigabytes. " "Either put these into the create volume web form or use" " the command line:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml492(para) msgid ""#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml501(para)"OpenStack Block Storage also allows for creating snapshots of volumes. " "Remember that this is a block level snapshot that is crash consistent, so it" " is best if the volume is not connected to an instance when the snapshot is ""forced to. To take a volume snapshot either select Create " "Snapshot from the actions column next to the volume name on the " "dashboard volume page, or run this from the command line:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml524(title)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml525(para)"If a user tries to create a volume and the volume immediately goes into an " "error state, the best way to troubleshoot is to grep the cinder log files " "for the volume's UUID. First try the log files on the cloud controller and " "then try the storage node where the volume was attempted to be created:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml536(title)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml537(para)"network properties, and how they are represented in the database."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml542(title)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml543(para)" name needn't be unique, but your life is simpler if it is because many " "tools will use the name in place of UUID so long as the name is unique. You " "can start an instance from the dashboard from the Launch " "Instance button on the Instances page or by" " selecting the Launch action next to an image or " "snapshot on the Images & Snapshots page."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml552(para) msgid "On the command line, do this:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml554(para)"the rest of this section before trying to start an instance, but this is the" " base command that later details are layered upon."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml559(para)"To delete instances from the dashboard select the Terminate " "instance action next to the instance on the " "Instances page. From the command line, do this:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml563(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml568(title)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml569(para)"If an instance fails to start and immediately moves to an error state, there""can be done with normal user access, while others require access to your log" " server or compute nodes."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml574(para)"instance. In these cases the error is apparent when you run a nova " "show on the faulted instance:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml608(para)"In this case, looking at the \"fault\" message shows NoValidHost, indicating" " that the scheduler was unable to match the instance requirements."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml611(para)"If nova show does not sufficiently explain the failure, ""your scheduler hosts is a good place to start looking for lower-level "#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml618(para)" instance was scheduled on as hostId. If the instance failed "#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml624(title)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml625(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml627(title)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml628(para)"For Compute, instance metadata is a collection of key-value pairs associated" " with an instance. Compute reads and writes to these key-value pairs any ""when the end user uses the Compute API to do so. However, you cannot query " "the instance-associated key-value pairs with the metadata service that is "#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml637(para)"For an example of instance metadata, users can generate and register ssh " "keys using the nova command:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml641(para)"This creates a key named , which you can associate with " "instances. The file mykey.pem is the private key, which" " should be saved to a secure location because it allows root access to " "instances the key is associated with."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml646(para)"To associate a key with an instance on boot, add --key_name "#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml655(para)"When booting a server, you can also add arbitrary metadata so that you can " "more easily identify it among other running instances. Use the "#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml665(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml696(title)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml697(para)"The user-data key is a special key in the metadata service that" " holds a file that cloud-aware applications within the guest instance can " "access. For example --file <dst-path=src-path> " "option. You may store up to five files. For example, let's say you have a " "special authorized_keys file named " "special_authorized_keysfile that for some reason you want to put on the " "instance instead of using the regular ssh key injection. In this case, you " "can use the following command:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml734(title)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml735(para)"Security groups, as discussed earlier, are typically required to allow " "network traffic to an instance, unless the default security group for a " "project has been modified to be more permissive."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml739(para)"from the dashboard you do this on the Access & " "Security tab of the Launch Instance dialog. " "When launching from the command line, append --security-groups " "with a comma-separated list of security groups."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml745(para)"running. Currently this is only available through the command-line tools. " "Here is an example:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml752(title) #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml175(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml753(para)"Where floating IPs are configured in a deployment, each project will have a " "limited number of floating IPs controlled by a quota. However, these need to" " be allocated to the project from the central pool prior to their " "use—usually by the administrator of the project. To allocate a floating IP " "to a project, use the Allocate IP to Project button " "on the Access & Security page of the dashboard. The" " command line can also be used:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml763(para)"Once allocated, a floating IP can be assigned to running instances from the " "dashboard either by selecting Associate Floating IP " "from the actions drop-down next to the IP on the Access & " "Security page or by making this selection next to the instance " "you want to associate it with on the Instances page. " "The inverse action, Dissociate Floating IP, is " "available only from the Access & Security page and " "not from the Instances page."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml773(para)"To associate or disassociate a floating IP with a server from the command "#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml780(title)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml781(para) msgid "" "You can attach block storage to instances from the dashboard on the " "Volumes page. Click the Edit " "Attachments action next to the volume you want to attach." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml785(para) msgid "To perform this action from command line, run the following command:" msgstr "" "nova command-line client with this option set:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml791(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml796(term)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml798(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml804(term)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml806(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml811(term)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml813(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml823(term)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml825(para)"The size of the volume in gigabytes. It is safe to leave this blank and have" " the Compute Service infer the size."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml831(term)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml833(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml841(para)"same time. The volume of ID 13 will be attached as /dev/vdc. It" " is not a snapshot, does not specify a size, and will not be deleted when " "the instance is terminated:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml848(para)"If you have previously prepared block storage with a bootable file system " "image, it is even possible to boot from persistent block storage. The " "following command boots an image from the specified volume. It is similar to" " the previous command, but the image is omitted and the volume is now " "attached as /dev/vda:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml857(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml861(para)"attaching a volume to the instance and for copying the image to the attached" " volume in the Images & Snapshots page splits content up into " "several areas:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml886(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml889(para)"difference between an image that you upload directly to the Image Service " "and an image that you create by snapshot is that an image created by " "snapshot has additional properties in the glance database. These properties " "are found in the image_properties table and include:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml899(th)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml900(th)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml905(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml906(para) #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml921(para) #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml4238(glossterm)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml909(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml910(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml914(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml915(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml920(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml926(title)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml927(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml932(title)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml933(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml939(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml945(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml949(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml955(para)"as databases), we recommend that you read the documentation for those "#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml962(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml965(para)"Running sync writes dirty buffers (buffered blocks that have " "been modified but not written yet to the disk block) to disk."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml968(para)"Just running sync is not enough to ensure that the file system " "is consistent. We recommend that you use the fsfreeze tool, " "which halts new access to the file system, and create a stable image on disk" " that is suitable for snapshotting. The fsfreeze tool supports " "several file systems, including ext3, ext4, and XFS. If your virtual machine" " instance is running on Ubuntu, install the util-linux package to get " "fsfreeze:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml978(para)"works at the virtual file system (VFS) level starting at 2.6.29. The " "xfs_freeze version supports the same command-line arguments as fsfreeze."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml987(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml994(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml997(para) msgid "-u: thaw (unfreeze) the system"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml1000(para)"To freeze the volume in preparation for snapshotting, you would do the " "following, as root, inside the instance:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml1004(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml1007(para)"other calls that modify the file system are halted. Most importantly, all "#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml1013(para)"operation and any I/O attempts are delayed until the file system has been "#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml1018(para)"snapshot. For example, if your instance was named mon-instance and you " "wanted to snapshot it to an image named mon-snapshot, you could now run the " "following:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml1024(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml1028(para)"If you want to backup the root file system, you can't simply run the command" " above because it will freeze the prompt. Instead, run the following one-" "liner, as root, inside the instance:"#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml1039(title)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml1040(para)"table you most likely need to look at in relation to user instances is the " "\"instances\" table."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml1044(para)"and deleted instances. It has a bewildering array of fields; for an " "exhaustive list, look at the database. These are the most useful fields for "#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml1051(para)"The deleted field is set to 1 if the instance has been deleted and NULL if " "it has not been deleted— this field is important for excluding deleted "#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml1055(para) msgid "" "The uuid field is the UUID of the instance and is used throughout other " "tables in the database as a foreign key. ./doc/openstack-ops/preface_ops.xml408(para)"OpenStack community members. Many " "individual efforts keep a community book alive. Our community members " "updated content for this book year-round. Also, a year after the first " "sprint, Jon Proulx hosted a second two-day mini-sprint at MIT with the goal " "of updating the book for the latest release. Since the book's inception, " "more than 30 contributors have supported this book. We have a tool chain for" " reviews, continuous builds, and translations. Writers and developers " "continuously review patches, enter doc bugs, edit content, and fix doc bugs." " "(For more hard work, turn the page to the next chapter where we discuss the " "system-facing operations: Maintenance, Failures and Debugging.)""OpenStack is founded on a thriving community which is a source of help, and " "welcomes your contributions. commit_message:
Move "Launch an Instance" to end of Install Guide

Moved the "Launch an Instance" section to the bottom of the
install guide, to prevent readers from having to jump around
from later chapters.  Also added a note at the end of every
chapter, starting with the Networking chapter, letting them
know that they can launch an instance or add additional
features.

Change-Id: Ie356370bb1a1efa28e36f8f2e25fdc3fff8b35d6
Implements: networking-install-guide-improvements
Closes-Bug: 1301180
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/38/84638/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <section xml:id="section_horizon-moving-on"> <title>Moving on</title> <para>At this point, you have everything you need for a basic OpenStack system, and can move on to <xref linkend="nova-boot" />. If you'd like to add additional features, you can also continue on to the next chapter.</para> </section>

commit_message:
Adds missing expected_errors for V3 API multinic extension

The V3 API multinic extension is missing the expected errors
decorators which means that unexpected internal Nova exceptions
are not caught correctly. This patch adds the expected error
decorators.

Change-Id: I99311275197bb5123079c8910855386252028dec
Closes-Bug: 1303781
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/12/85712/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @extensions.expected_errors(404) @extensions.expected_errors((400,404))

commit_message:
Enable ServerGroup scheduler filters by default

The Icehouse release includes a server group REST API. For these
groups to actually function properly, the server group scheduler
filters must be enabled. So, these filters should be enabled by
default since the API is also enabled by default. If the API is not
used, the scheduler filters will be a no-op.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ia52d7fcfff52377d8beae2acd9b7eba9c6c74e09
Closes-bug: #1303983
(cherry picked from commit 7b8402ed3ba734836119441bdf1a6d6c661c8df2)

added_lines: Description =========== This cookbook installs the OpenStack Integration Test Suite **Tempest** as part of an OpenStack reference deployment Chef for OpenStack. The http://github.com/mattray/chef-openstack-repo contains documentation for using this cookbook in the context of a full OpenStack deployment. https://github.com/openstack/tempest Requirements ============ Chef 11 or higher is required. commit_message:
add tests for extension: os-extended-volume

this add tests for extension: os-extended-volume.
also add an parameter in xml_to_json in order to we can some
xml element that should be transferred to the type: list.
like the following case:
<os-extended-volumes:volume_attached id="c524a65f-164a-4677-a051-b80022b41e8c"/>
<os-extended-volumes:volume_attached id="c68a8540-05dd-4abd-a689-f02ddd029a23"/>
should be transferred to:
volume_attached: [{"id": c524a65f-164a-4677-a051-b80022b41e8c},
                  {"id": c68a8540-05dd-4abd-a689-f02ddd029a23}]
currently it will be transferred to:
volume_attached: {"id": c68a8540-05dd-4abd-a689-f02ddd029a23}
the first volume id will be overridden.

this patch also addresses this issue by the way.

Change-Id: Ib1ca03ab7b693bf91de577b89707b265248cdffb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/64/56364/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def xml_to_json(node, *attr_expected_list): if tag in attr_expected_list: if tag in json: json[tag].append(xml_to_json(child)) else: json[tag] = [xml_to_json(child)] else: json[tag] = xml_to_json(child)

commit_message:
add tests for server detail and show with extensions

this adds the tests for server detail and show action with
the following extensions:
keypair
config_drive
extended_availability_zone
extend_status
extended_server_attributes

*this also remove the _host_key in test_aggregates.py for xml test,
it needn't be handled specially now.

Change-Id: I3ecaca5a64dcdd5ff8dc3f2d18f7ca58ac04395d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/24/56324/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_create_specify_keypair_and_detail_show_with_keypair(self): # verify the server show extensions # extension: keypair params = {'name': server['name']} resp, body = self.client.list_servers_with_detail(params) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) # verify the server detail extensions # extension: keypair self.assertEqual(key_name, body['servers'][0]['key_name'])

commit_message:
Implement disk shrink to libvirt driver

Update libvirt driver to implement resize disk down

Implements blueprint libvirt-resize-disk-down

Change-Id: Iee814803c8ff4b8a66c2cbfd8445216b41eddc00
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/21/79321/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: action = cmp(size, disk.get_disk_size(info['path'])) if action == 1: disk.extend(info['path'], size, use_cow=use_cow) elif action == -1: disk.shrink(info['path'], size, use_cow=use_cow) else: LOG.info(_("Not necessary to update disk size."))
deleted_lines: disk.can_resize_image(info['path'], size) and disk.extend(info['path'], size, use_cow=use_cow)

commit_message:
Add method to shrink disk image

Add a 'shrink' method to disk.api that provides a
resizing disk down of an image.

Related to blueprint libvirt-resize-disk-down

Change-Id: I0ea8c798f22fcd7b557935aefc690d6bf0bdac34
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/98/78998/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.openstack.common import unitsdef shrink(image, size, use_cow=False): """Skink image to size.""" if (get_disk_size(image) <= size or not is_image_partitionless(image, use_cow)): return if use_cow: mounter = mount.Mount.instance_for_format( image, None, None, 'qcow2') if mounter.get_dev(): safe_resize2fs(mounter.device, size / units.Gi, run_as_root=True, finally_call=mounter.unget_dev) else: safe_resize2fs(image, size / units.Gi) utils.execute('qemu-img', 'resize', image, size)

commit_message:
Add safe_resize2fs to be public

Moves safe_resize2fs method outside the method extend
to be used as a public method of disk.api.

Related to blueprint libvirt-resize-disk-down

Change-Id: Id0a5b261abb5c5a247e27e60c6cb3936d866aa78
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/97/78997/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def safe_resize2fs(dev, size=None, run_as_root=False, finally_call=lambda: None): """Calls resize2fs by handling ProcessExceptionError Calls resize2fs by handling ProcessExceptionError, also adds an extra parameter finally_call that accepts a method will be called in all case at the end of the process. """ try: resize2fs(dev, size, run_as_root=run_as_root, check_exit_code=[0]) except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as exc: LOG.debug(_("Resizing the file system with resize2fs " "has failed with error: %s"), exc) finally: finally_call()
deleted_lines: def safe_resize2fs(dev, run_as_root=False, finally_call=lambda: None): try: resize2fs(dev, run_as_root=run_as_root, check_exit_code=[0]) except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as exc: LOG.debug(_("Resizing the file system with resize2fs " "has failed with error: %s"), exc) finally: finally_call()

commit_message:
Add in a concurrency aware subunit filter

A live filter for subunit stream that will let us display the
concurrency of the streams as we go.

This includes a visual offset filter, which makes it very
quick to see execution in the workers.

Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>

Change-Id: I1b529546e005f47aba56b451e1c0d8b0da09fca3

commit_message:
Refactor mysql and redis apps

Reasons:
 - each time mysql and redis manager and
   backup/restore strategies instantiate
   mysql/redis app object. This is not
   correct since mysql app doesn't change
   while guest is working.

Changes:
 - app refactoring;
 - tests refactoring;

Change-Id: I9b7c13e166d98c75f3cad1bf92c23a13a06557fd
Implements: blueprint refactor-database-app-guest-functionality

commit_message:
Add hidden attribute to output params in HOT DSL

This would allow for controlling the display/providing of sensitive
information in the outputs section.

The use case of hidden outputs:
  A user defines outputs in the template that includes sensitive data,
  such as username/password information, that I don't necessarily
  want displayed at all times, similar to how template parameters can
  be hidden.
  E.g.: I may not be in a safe environment to have that information in
  the open.

Co-Authored-By: Anderson Mesquita <andersonvom@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint add-hidden-attribute-to-outputs
Change-Id: I7755aeef8a9b1e9b6ee4ec200f17e5e05b8d701d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/92/75492/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: hidden: <true | false>hidden: This *optional* attribute allows for specifying whether the output should be hidden when showing information about a stack at runtime (e.g. for hiding passwords that were specified as parameters). If not specified, the default value 'false' will be used. The example below shows, how the IP address of a compute resource and the database password can be defined as output parameters. db_password: description: the database password value: { get_param: db_password } hidden: true
deleted_lines: The example below shows, how the IP address of a compute resource can be defined as an output parameter.

subject: Use cwd for lock_path(directory) if directory is empty
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-01 11:28:07.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/7c9b24dd870fba1350b95c648f5910fe525ed707', 'message': "Use cwd for lock_path(directory) if directory is empty

lock_path(directory) fails if the directory is ''. This happens for
example if one is using swift-account-info on a database in the
current directory; in that case os.path.dirname() returns ''.

This patch replaces an empty directory name with os.getcwd() and
adds a verifying unit test.

Fixes-Bug: 1300721
Change-Id: Ibcb6475138e83aa558163e273b0ce11109f13515
"}]
commit_message:
Use cwd for lock_path(directory) if directory is empty

lock_path(directory) fails if the directory is ''. This happens for
example if one is using swift-account-info on a database in the
current directory; in that case os.path.dirname() returns ''.

This patch replaces an empty directory name with os.getcwd() and
adds a verifying unit test.

Fixes-Bug: 1300721
Change-Id: Ibcb6475138e83aa558163e273b0ce11109f13515
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/11/84411/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_lock_path_cwd(self): tmpdir = mkdtemp() os.chdir(tmpdir) try: with utils.lock_path('', 0.1): exc = None success = False try: with utils.lock_path(tmpdir, 0.1): success = True except LockTimeout as err: exc = err self.assertTrue(exc is not None) self.assertTrue(not success) finally: shutil.rmtree(tmpdir)

commit_message:
xenapi: Add messages to spawn steps

The messages will be used to describe what each update step respresents
in compute instance update notifications.

Change-Id: I84441dd6d1bf454c87611d8d760dc9050cbe54c9
Implements: message-in-update-notifications

commit_message:
Add a message to update notifications

Add a human readable message to compute instance notifications.  This
will make it easier for notification consumers to deduce the purpose of
the update.

Change-Id: Ib1cf9219056e9052e3b62d05d884e306e707d0df
Implements: blueprint message-in-update-notifications

Change-Id: I6ca71ffe7acd9c1b7bf5b1c57899f93518c11113
'}]
commit_message:
Propose: adding region support to neutron

Continuation of bp: pass-region-to-neutron

Change-Id: I6ca71ffe7acd9c1b7bf5b1c57899f93518c11113
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/00/82600/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. .. ============================= Add region support to neutron ============================= Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/pass-region-to-neutron In this blueprint we aim to make neutron aware of the region that an instances port lives. This is required for metadata and nova-neutron events if we want to support the deployment model of multiple nova regions backed by a single neutron deployment. This is something we want to support so that one can span a network between multiple nova regions. Problem description =================== Neutron is unable to support metadata and nova-neutron events if there are multiple compute regions. Proposed change =============== In order to implement this I propose that we pass os_region_name to neutron in nova/network/neturonv2/api.py so neutron is aware of the nova regions each port is in. In addition, if one changes os_region_name in nova it would be nice if that information propagated to neutron. In order to do this I think we should add code that updates the region name on neutron ports if needed as part of the periodic cache healer. Alternatives ------------ REST API impact --------------- Notifications impact -------------------- Other End user impact --------------------- Deployer impact --------------- If deploying nova with multiple regions one needs to set os_region_name in nova.conf on all the compute nodes in the region. This seems to already be a requirement if deploying multiple nova regions with cinder as well. Developer impact ---------------- Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: arosen Milestones ---------- Originally approved for: Juno-1 Completed: None Work Items ---------- Work items or tasks -- break the feature up into the things that need to be done to implement it. Those parts might end up being done by different people, but we're mostly trying to understand the timeline for implementation. Dependencies ============ We first need to add the ability for neutron to store the region on a port before we merge this change in nova. Testing ======= Documentation Impact ==================== Same as Deployer impact

commit_message:
Ensure network interfaces are in requested order

_build_network_info_model was iterating current_neutron_ports
instead of port_ids which contains ports in their correctly requested
order. Because of this the requested nic order was no longer being
perserved. This patch fixes this and also changes the order of ports
in test_build_network_info_model() so this case is tested.

Closes-bug: #1300325

Conflicts:

	nova/network/neutronv2/api.py
	nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py

Change-Id: Ia9e71364bca6cbc24ebc1c234e6a5af14f51cd62
(cherry picked from commit 720e7f939859fbfe6b0c79ef3a6d5e43c916da65)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/82/84582/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Load user un-lazily if needed

Add a keystone lookup if the user is not found in class cache.
This can happen if a user is created after prefetching.
Forcing a lookup and refreshing cache fix this issue.

Change-Id: I8c74d955539c224f82755fb6b29a9fa562ad8959
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/33/78333/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # rebuild the cache for every puppet run @user_hash ||= {} @user_hash[user] = @user_hash[user] || get_user(@tenant_hash[tenant], user) @user_hash[user], def self.get_user(name) unless (@users and @users[name]) @users = {} list_keystone_objects('user', 4).each do |user| if user[1] == name @users[user[1]] = user[0] end end end @users[name] end
deleted_lines: # rebuild the cahce for every puppet run @user_hash ||= {} get_user(@tenant_hash[tenant], user), def self.get_user(tenant_id, name) @users ||= {} user_key = "#{name}@#{tenant_id}" unless @users[user_key] list_keystone_objects('user', 4, '--tenant-id', tenant_id).each do |user| @users["#{user[1]}@#{tenant_id}"] = user[0] end end @users[user_key] end

commit_message:
Add rainbows and unicorns to status messages

This causes success and failure messages to be presented in a much more
professional manner.

Art assets and code by www.cornify.com

Change-Id: Iae146ccf63680011185b64c59d4abd4917d28e7a
Implements: blueprint unicorn-power

commit_message:
Fix ssl link for percona on i686

The ssl link for percona on i686 references the incorrect directory
(i686 instead of i386).

Change-Id: Id7397107465854eaf4d2de5c12b4a202e4723516
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/23/86223/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ "$ARCH" == "amd64" ]; then LIB_PREFIX=/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu else LIB_PREFIX=/lib/$ARCH-linux-gnu fi

subject: Bootstrap 2 to Bootstrap 3 update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-04 10:00:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/b3c1785b624e1047e0674034b382d32eb24f4589', 'message': 'Bootstrap 2 to Bootstrap 3 update

This draft is for lesscpy debug puposes as lesscpy is not able to succesfully compile the bootstrap 3
and horizon.less as it does not support all required Less features.

Initial bootstrap files update: updated less, fonts and js bootstrap files, removed bootstrap images
Replaced old variables with new in horizon.less
Renamed row-fluid class to row
Replaced grid span class with col-md- class
New icon classes and put icons into span element where possible
New button classes
Removed button icons in favour of upcoming font-icons blueprint
Added bootstrap overrides less structure to enable clean overriding of bootstrap features
Fixed dropdowns
Tables overrides, tweaks
Fixed messages
Updated modals templates, js, styling to work with new bootstrap 3 modals
Updated forms using django-bootstrap-forms, alerts, tooltips and form validation messages, data-add-item select fix
Membership widget update
Table head fixes, tenant switcher fix, sidebar navtabs fix, fix tabgroup clearing, datepicker fixes,
workflow footer buttons fix, cancel button fix, make primary submit button smaller, fix modal scrolling issue
with dropdown_fix

Implements: blueprint bootstrap-update

Change-Id: I225246b9f8f27cd8c653ec777390686c36b01b90

commit_message:
Bootstrap 2 to Bootstrap 3 update

This draft is for lesscpy debug puposes as lesscpy is not able to succesfully compile the bootstrap 3
and horizon.less as it does not support all required Less features.

Initial bootstrap files update: updated less, fonts and js bootstrap files, removed bootstrap images
Replaced old variables with new in horizon.less
Renamed row-fluid class to row
Replaced grid span class with col-md- class
New icon classes and put icons into span element where possible
New button classes
Removed button icons in favour of upcoming font-icons blueprint
Added bootstrap overrides less structure to enable clean overriding of bootstrap features
Fixed dropdowns
Tables overrides, tweaks
Fixed messages

commit_message:
Upgrade bootstrap 2 to bootstrap 3

This draft is for the review purposes, it includes revert to lessc library
as only that is able to succesfully compile bootstrap 3

Enable back lessc:
Revert "Drop NodeJS dependency in favor of pure-python lesscpy"
This reverts commit a0739c9423a4c559b45af96fa4cdb30539dcdbd7.
Update lessc library in horizon

Initial bootstrap files update: updated less, fonts and js bootstrap files, removed bootstrap images
Replaced old variables with new in horizon.less
Renamed row-fluid class to row
Replaced grid span class with col-md- class
New icon classes and put icons into span element where possible
New button classes
Removed button icons in favour of upcoming font-icons blueprint
Added bootstrap overrides less structure to enable clean overriding of bootstrap features
Fixed dropdowns
Tables overrides, tweaks
Fixed messages
Updated modals templates, js, styling to work with new bootstrap 3 modals
Updated forms using django-bootstrap-forms, alerts, tooltips and form validation messages, data-add-item select fix
Membership widget update
Table head fixes, tenant switcher fix, sidebar navtabs fix, fix tabgroup clearing, datepicker fixes,
workflow footer buttons fix, cancel button fix, make primary submit button smaller, fix modal scrolling issue
with dropdown_fix

Implements: blueprint bootstrap-update

Change-Id: I5324038756ba98c59d3db0b0d2cd4c14c5c8be9c

commit_message:
Deactivate LV before removing

With certain versions of LVM2, removing an active LV can end up with

  Unable to deactivate open XXX
  libdevmapper exiting with 1 device(s) still suspended.

which causes any lvm command afterwards to hang endlessly on
trying to access the suspended volume. This seems to be caused
by a race with udev, so lets be conservative and do the deactivation,
then wait for udev and then finish the removal.

Closes-Bug: #1270192

Change-Id: I4703133180567090878ea5047dd29d9f97ad85ab

commit_message:
Add note on aggregate duplication to API docco

Provide some additional clarity on allowable duplication
in the selectable aggregates passed to a statistics query.

Change-Id: If534e0667aa08fd531bbf31032e7648f7b80890c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/17/83817/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: (where aggregate.param is optional). Duplicate aggregate function and parameter pairs are silently discarded from the statistics query. Partial duplicates, in the sense of the same function but differing parameters (e.g. aggregate.func=cardinality&aggregate.param=resource_id and aggregate.func=cardinality&aggregate.param=project_id), are on other hand both allowed by the API and supported by the storage drivers. See the :ref:`functional-examples` section for more detail.
deleted_lines: (where aggregate.param is optional). See the :ref:`functional-examples` section for more detail.

commit_message:
Sync oslo imageutils, strutils to Nova

Changes in imageutils:
===============================
b455fac Enable decimal value input in imageutils.QemuImgInfo
bec3a5e Implements SI/IEC unit system conversion to bytes
8b2b0b7 Use hacking import_exceptions for gettextutils._
aad179d Fixing misspelled encryption key in QemuImgInfo
12bcdb7 Remove vim header
2bd46eb Refactors byte size extraction logic

Changes in strutils:
====================
bec3a5e Implements SI/IEC unit system conversion to bytes
e53fe85 strutils bool_from_string, allow specified default
8b2b0b7 Use hacking import_exceptions for gettextutils._
84d461e Fix a bug in safe_encode where it returns a bytes object in py3
12bcdb7 Remove vim header
3970d46 Fix typos in oslo
1a2df89 Enable H302 hacking check
67bd769 python3: Fix traceback while running python3.
b0c51ec Refactors to_bytes

Change-Id: I3e887756af37823dc6486d1496222825ddc20f0c
Related-bug: #1189635
Related-bug: #1193765
Related-Bug: #1257829
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/42/66242/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ SIZE_RE = re.compile(r"(\d+)(\w+)?(\s*\(\s*(\d+)\s+bytes\s*\))?", re.I) self.encrypted = details.get('encrypted') if self.encrypted: lines.append("encrypted: %s" % self.encrypted) if not real_size: raise ValueError(_('Invalid input value "%s".') % details) magnitude = real_size.group(1) unit_of_measure = real_size.group(2) bytes_info = real_size.group(3) if bytes_info: return int(real_size.group(4)) elif not unit_of_measure: return int(magnitude) return strutils.to_bytes('%s%s' % (magnitude, unit_of_measure)) if root_details == 'None': real_details = 0 else: real_details = self._extract_bytes(root_details)
deleted_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 from nova.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ # noqa SIZE_RE = re.compile(r"\(\s*(\d+)\s+bytes\s*\)", re.I) self.encryption = details.get('encryption') if real_size: details = real_size.group(1) try: details = strutils.to_bytes(details) except TypeError: pass return details real_details = self._extract_bytes(root_details)

commit_message:
Add common base class for agent functional tests

Refactor the functional tests a bit to add a common base class for agent
tests. This is needed an upcoming commit which adds a functional test
for VXLAN version checking.

Closes-Bug: #1301363

Change-Id: I438e401cbfb40e5557e5125f2a409bac5c1fd1c2

added_lines: # Copyright 2013 Cisco Systems, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os import random from neutron.agent.linux import utils from neutron.tests import base class BaseAgentClass(): def check_command(self, cmd, error_text, skip_msg): try: utils.execute(cmd) except RuntimeError as e: if error_text in str(e): self.skipTest(skip_msg) raise def check_sudo(self): if os.environ.get('OS_SUDO_TESTING') not in base.TRUE_STRING: return False else: return True def get_rand_name(self, name='test'): return name + str(random.randint(1, 0x7fffffff)) def create_ovs_resource(self, name_prefix, creation_func): """Create a new ovs resource that does not already exist. :param name_prefix: The prefix for a randomly generated name :param creation_func: A function taking the name of the resource to be created. An error is assumed to indicate a name collision. """ while True: name = self.get_rand_name(name_prefix) try: return creation_func(name) except RuntimeError: continue break

commit_message:
NSX: Fix KeyError in sync if nsx_router_id not found

Previously, a KeyError would occur in the sync code which would
cause the sync thread to stop running. This would occur if there
was a router entry in the database but no nsx_router_mapping and
the router was not found in nsx. Note: this should never happen unless
one did not run the db migration which introduced and migrated the data
for the NeutronNsxRouterMapping table.

Change-Id: I44f3e7de9323f594501db63d3ad33e80e617bfdc
Closes-bug: #1304647
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/43/86143/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.plugins.vmware.dbexts import db def test_synchronize_router_nsx_mapping_not_found(self): ctx = context.get_admin_context() with self._populate_data(ctx): # Put a router down to verify synchronization lr_uuid = self.fc._fake_lrouter_dict.keys()[0] q_rtr_id = self._get_tag_dict( self.fc._fake_lrouter_dict[lr_uuid]['tags'])['q_router_id'] self.fc._fake_lrouter_dict[lr_uuid]['status'] = 'false' q_rtr_data = self._plugin._get_router(ctx, q_rtr_id) # delete router mapping from db. db.delete_neutron_nsx_router_mapping(ctx.session, q_rtr_id) # pop router from fake nsx client router_data = self.fc._fake_lrouter_dict.pop(lr_uuid) self._plugin._synchronizer.synchronize_router(ctx, q_rtr_data) # Reload from db q_routers = self._plugin.get_routers(ctx) for q_rtr in q_routers: if q_rtr['id'] == q_rtr_id: exp_status = constants.NET_STATUS_ERROR else: exp_status = constants.NET_STATUS_ACTIVE self.assertEqual(exp_status, q_rtr['status']) # put the router database since we don't handle missing # router data in the fake nsx api_client self.fc._fake_lrouter_dict[lr_uuid] = router_data

subject: Add configurable ovsdb monitor respawn interval
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-09 22:53:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/841ab7d9d7048016d3758c3ceb7c8a64b5531332', 'message': "Add configurable ovsdb monitor respawn interval

If minimize_polling=True and the ovsdb-client process died, the
default respawn interval of 0 would mean that we'd start polling
again. This patch adds the option ovsdb_monitor_respawn_interval and
defaults it to 30 seconds.

commit_message:
Add configurable ovsdb monitor respawn interval

If minimize_polling=True and the ovsdb-client process died, the
default respawn interval of 0 would mean that we'd start polling
again. This patch adds the option ovsdb_monitor_respawn_interval and
defaults it to 30 seconds.

Change-Id: I12c1e05ec4d6d2bd4d84024a91116e2ac3974868
Close-Bug: 1243867
(cherry picked from commit 14950e492ad4423aa6f8719f7178b0477294ba5a)

commit_message:
Verify the response attributes of 'aggregate-set-metadata' API

This patch verifies the response attributes of 'aggregate-set-metadata'.
The response attributes of v2 and v3 are the same:
{
    "aggregate": {
        "availability_zone": "nova",
        "created_at": "2012-11-16T06:22:22.342791",
        "deleted": false,
        "deleted_at": null,
        "hosts": [],
        "id": 1,
        "metadata": {
            "availability_zone": "nova",
            "key": "value"
        },
        "name": "name",
        "updated_at": null
    }
}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I8940a18e71540aec300023e6736a3318b253d702

commit_message:
Hide ipv6 subnet API attributes

The attributes for ra mode and address mode should be hidden
until the IPv6 feature is fully implemented.

The changes in this patch will be reverted by another patch
which closes this bug.

Change-Id: I69a1a571b5beb566641200e60b84f0716c1ec138
Related-Bug: 1304093
(cherry picked from commit d739486a3f70cb83f8730cf7201a8b8ccf4b4c70)

commit_message:
auth_token middleware hashes tokens with sha256

The auth_token middleware always hashed PKI Tokens with MD5. This
change makes it so that PKI tokens can be hashed with SHA256. This
is for security hardening.

Both SHA256 and MD5 will be tried when checking against the
revocation list. This will support identity servers that are not
configured for SHA256.

When storing the PKI token in the local cache, the sha256 hash will
always be used.

SecurityImpact
Closes-Bug: #1174499

Change-Id: I9fe61354103b59dfd292740fbec35e9c6f5ef765

commit_message:
Fix Jenkins translation jobs

The -propose-translation-update and -upstream-translation-update
jobs do not update from transifex since our po files contain
duplicate entries where obsolete entries duplicate normal entries.

Remove all obsolete entries to fix the jobs.

Change-Id: Ia174a145e71ab6c2bfd99f06e8ebead2e91e15ea
Closes-Bug: #1299349

commit_message:
Check top-level sections when parsing a template

This patch adds validation to template parsing to detect any sections
that do not comply with allowed sections in a template. In the past,
there have been cases where small typos in section names (e.g.
'output' instead of 'outputs') did not get detected and caused issues
at a later point, i.e. by simply not showing any stack outputs.

The place where the template.validate() call has been added to the
parser code only affects new stacks and rejects invalid templates
with an error message. This does not affect stacks that are already
in the database (I did some tests to check this).

Change-Id: Ifed4207badeb364675c905224ba762a9d8eaedd9
Closes-Bug: #1297761
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/01/85901/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # validate overall template (top-level structure) tmpl.validate()

commit_message:
Fix timeout for stack actions

The problem is that the timeout for running any action (i.e. create or update)
on stack is not passed from parent stack to nested stack.
All heat resources which are internally implemented as StackResource are
affected. For example AutoScalingGroup always using default timeout
(60 minutes). If creating any of the instances will take more that it will
fail no matter what timeout you will pass creating stack.

Changes:
* removes hardcoded timeout (60 minutes)
* adds new config option to specify timeout for stack action
* if timeout was not specified for nested stack then timeout from parent
  is used
* adds test for StackResource and parser.Stack

Change-Id: I39494b75774988c625cb22cc7873d628c04d3228
Closes-Bug: 1287719

commit_message:
Correctly inherit __table_args__ from parent class

Where unique constraints are added to certain tables by populating
__table_args__, we need to ensure we inherit the top level
__table_args__ that define the default storage engine to use when
creating tables.

Change-Id: Ib886b84922830b60282b4f882591e43f5041e713
Fixes: bug 1288358
(cherry picked from commit 72e37ddcd067432675543c8f4d327fe766bc8044)

subject: Attempt to ensure connect always timesout
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-04 19:30:41.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_obj.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/9d0067a0f546ce8a0fddb257655f2944c05e35e6', 'message': 'Attempt to ensure connect always timesout

It seems that the test_connect_put_timeout() test does not always fail
when it is expected. Sometimes, not very often, the attempt to connect
succeeds, resulting in a failed test.

This might be because the fake-connection infrastructure uses a
sleep(0.1) and the test uses a connect timeout of 0.1. There might be a
case where the two values result in the exact time where the entries
happen to be added in the wrong order such that the sleep() completes
first before the connect timeout fires, where the connect completes
successfully.

Closes bug 1302781

Change-Id: Ie23e40cf294170eccdf0713e313f9a31a92f9071
'}]
commit_message:
Attempt to ensure connect always timesout

It seems that the test_connect_put_timeout() test does not always fail
when it is expected. Sometimes, not very often, the attempt to connect
succeeds, resulting in a failed test.

This might be because the fake-connection infrastructure uses a
sleep(0.1) and the test uses a connect timeout of 0.1. There might be a
case where the two values result in the exact time where the entries
happen to be added in the wrong order such that the sleep() completes
first before the connect timeout fires, where the connect completes
successfully.

Closes bug 1302781

Change-Id: Ie23e40cf294170eccdf0713e313f9a31a92f9071

commit_message:
update setup.py with pbr version

This file is normally updated in the standard "update from
global requirements" patch, but since those contain other
changes we don't want, the setup.py file never gets updated.

This patch updates setup.py to bring it in line with the
standard global requirements way of doing things without also
updating [test-]requirements.txt

Change-Id: Id0e4f8e17dd4c714b4d2dd75985431a9e12e6a4f

commit_message:
Cherry pick oslo-incubator db fixes

The patch cherrypicks 2 fixes related to utf8 migration:

 * Ib5c0f93c788afda92aad862e50dc086dc39605f1: Ignore migrate versioning tables in utf8 sanity check

 * I7f271d846141ac72dde3fb0d12159b125018eb2c: Make table utf-8 charset checking be optional for DB migration

Change-Id: Icb811e846c05f863a42611054f2e3f30a47573db
Closes-Bug: #1301036
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/41/85941/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def db_sync(engine, abs_path, version=None, init_version=0, sanity_check=True): :param sanity_check: Require schema sanity checking for all tables if sanity_check: _db_schema_sanity_check(engine) # NOTE(morganfainberg): exclude the sqlalchemy-migrate and alembic # versioning tables from the tables we need to verify utf8 status on. # Non-standard table names are not supported. EXCLUDED_TABLES = ['migrate_version', 'alembic_version'] table_names = [res[0] for res in engine.execute(onlyutf8_sql, engine.url.database) if res[0].lower() not in EXCLUDED_TABLES]
deleted_lines: def db_sync(abs_path, version=None, init_version=0): _db_schema_sanity_check() table_names = [res[0] for res in engine.execute(onlyutf8_sql, engine.url.database)]

commit_message:
Volume size could be specified to create volume

1. Provide a "volume_size" config at VolumeGroup
2. Make size as optional prameter, modify all volumes_client to
read the size from CONf if size is None.
3. Modify the testcase: test_volume_create_get_update
_delete_from_image to call create_volume with no size
parameter specified.

Change-Id: I2897f6d6bd970f73867f56d9d23a768cafcbfd80
Closes-Bug: #1293885
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/71/81471/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: create_size = 1 # for bug 1293885: # If create a volume from image, set the volume size equals # to image size if 'imageRef' in kwargs and kwargs.get('imageRef'): imageRef = kwargs.get('imageRef') body = self.os.images_client.get_image(imageRef)[1] # Get size from image client and cast to gigabit create_size = body.get('OS-EXT-IMG-SIZE:size') if create_size: create_size = create_size / 1024 / 1024 / 1024 resp, volume = self.client.create_volume(create_size=create_size,

subject: Adds Ironic test_baremetal_basic_ops scenario test

commit_message:
Adds Ironic test_baremetal_basic_ops scenario test

Adds an Ironic scenario test that validates a full instance
boot using Ironic.  In addition to verifying the Nova instance
boots and has connectivity, it monitors power and state transitions
on the Ironic side.  It currently validates orchestration of the pxe_ssh
driver but the goal would be to support other drivers, and test them
conditionally based on the driver associated with the configured Ironic
node.

Change-Id: I7a98ab9c771fe17387dfb591df5a40d27194a5c8

commit_message:
Update percona xtradb-cluster package

It appears that percona no longer offers a binary with static linked
ssl. Updating the download URL and symlink hacks to work with new
package.

Closes-Bug: #1304629
Change-Id: I0563375c46bd4dcc2b704128ddc742ec11bb6459

commit_message:
Deals with fails in update_*_postcommit ops

It makes all mechanism drivers called even when one
of the mechanism drivers fails during a post commit
operation for updating network/subnet/port. This is
a stopgap measure until a more comprehensive approach
is adopted and implemented.

Change-Id: Ia9080a91ce768d4007b0525548acfe7443a2973c
Partial-Bug: 1227336

commit_message:
Don't specify admin_token in paste config

This is not a value that is going to be useful on other systems and
shouldn't be included in the default pipeline.

Closes-Bug: #1299332
Change-Id: I714539b7536965fa08a3ddc64493b481df7397e3

commit_message:
Credentials for native heat os-collect-config polling

For Server software_config_transport=POLL_SERVER_HEAT the os-collect-config
configuration has been changed in the following way:
* included stack_id and resource_name
* replaced username with user_id, since domain users should always be
  referenced by ID.
* renamed the collector key from "heat_server_poll" to "heat" since that
  is the intended name for the heat collector in os-collect-config

Closes-Bug: #1299986

Change-Id: I42326c81c7276d7d305a05c00d72a6102e80abca

commit_message:
Allow for stack users in _authorize_stack_user

This change allows stack user credentials to be used to call
describe_stack_resource (heat resource-metadata)

It makes the following changes:
* _authorize_stack_user first attempts authorize with
  stack.access_allowed using the context user_id before falling back
  to looking for ec2 credentials
* context middleware sets the user_id on the context even when the
  username is not specified

This change also adds missing test coverage to ContextMiddleware

Change-Id: Idb655e403ba11a3144dacf34eba0feb59ab8d911
Closes-Bug: #1299982
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/98/85898/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # first check whether access is allowd by context user_id if stack.access_allowed(cnxt.user_id, resource_name): return True # fall back to looking for EC2 credentials in the context
deleted_lines: # We're expecting EC2 credentials because all in-instance credentials # are deployed as ec2 keypairs

commit_message:
define ceph::key.

Provides keyring management.

Handles cephkeys (cephx), creating keyring files, injecting keys into
the keyring via ceph and ceph-autotool tools. Includes support for
multiple keys in the same keyring file (as this is supported by the
ceph-authtool tool).

Includes rspec system puppet for validation.

Change-Id: Ib3c4832ffcff61ab42ae221cdd5a5bfb76ee36c5
Implements: blueprint puppet-ceph#key
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceph refs/changes/79/81179/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Copyright (C) 2014 Catalyst IT Limited. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. # # Author: Ricardo Rocha <ricardo@catalyst.net.nz> # # Handles ceph keys (cephx), generates keys, creates keyring files, injects # keys into or delete keys from the cluster/keyring via ceph and ceph-autotool # tools. # ### == Name # # The full ceph ID name, e.g. 'client.admin' or 'mon.'. # ### == Parameters # # [*secret*] Key secret. # Mandatory. # # [*keyring_path*] Path to the keyring file. # Optional. Absolute path to the keyring file, including the file name. # Defaults to /etc/ceph/${title}keyring. # # [*cap_mon*] cephx capabilities for MON access. # Optional. e.g. 'allow *' # Defaults to 'undef'. # # [*cap_osd*] cephx capabilities for OSD access. # Optional. e.g. 'allow *' # Defaults to 'undef'. # # [*cap_mds*] cephx capabilities for MDS access. # Optional. e.g. 'allow *' # Defaults to 'undef'. # # [*user*] Owner of the keyring file. # Optional. Defaults to 'root'. # # [*group*] Group of the keyring file. # Optional. Defaults to 'root'. # # [*mode*] Mode (permissions) of the keyring file. # Optional. Defaults to 0600. # # [*inject*] True if the key should be injected into the cluster. # Optional. Boolean value (true to inject the key). # Default to false. # # [*ensure*] 'present' or 'absent'. # Optional. Should the given key be present or absent in the system. # Defaults to 'present'. # define ceph::key ( $secret, $keyring_path = "/etc/ceph/ceph.${name}.keyring", $cap_mon = '', $cap_osd = '', $cap_mds = '', $user = 'root', $group = 'root', $mode = '0600', $inject = false, ) { $caps = "--cap mon '${cap_mon}' --cap osd '${cap_osd}' --cap mds '${cap_mds}'" # this allows multiple defines for the same 'keyring file', # which is supported by ceph-authtool if ! defined(File[$keyring_path]) { exec {"${keyring_path}-touch": command => "/usr/bin/touch ${keyring_path}", creates => $keyring_path, require => Package['ceph'], } file {$keyring_path: ensure => file, owner => $user, group => $group, mode => $mode, require => Exec["${keyring_path}-touch"], } } exec {"ceph-key-${name}": command => "/usr/bin/ceph-authtool ${keyring_path} --name '${name}' --add-key '${secret}' ${caps}", unless => "/bin/grep ${secret} ${keyring_path}", require => Package['ceph'], } File[$keyring_path] -> Exec["ceph-key-${name}"] if $inject == true { exec {"ceph-injectkey-${name}": command => "/usr/bin/ceph auth add ${name} --in-file=${keyring_path}", unless => "/usr/bin/ceph auth list | /bin/grep '${secret}'", require => [ Package['ceph'], Exec["ceph-key-${name}"], ], } } }

commit_message:
Fix Jenkins translation jobs

The jobs heat-propose-translation-update and
heat-upstream-translation-update do not update from
transifex since our po files contain duplicate entries where
obsolete entries duplicate normal entries.

Remove all obsolete entries to fix the jobs.

Change-Id: I2071e3a792d107840449bbfe39e3a540ea1b626f
Closes-Bug: #1299349

commit_message:
Add a resource_facade intrinsic function to HOT

Add a native version of the function, rather than continue to rely on
Fn::ResourceFacade from the Heat-flavoured-cfn templates.

Closes-bug: #1299205

Change-Id: Iee118aeaa72d59e4d6a27ed487b99e9aba9779cd

commit_message:
Resolve data from Resource Facade

Since we are looking directly at the template data for the resource facade,
we need to resolve any intrinsic functions that may be present. (For
example, this would be expected if we ever had more than one level of
provider templates, or if e.g. the DeletionPolicy was passed as parameter
to the main stack).

Closes-bug: #1299204

Change-Id: Iaae2fe7be6618c1dee84f2c90bdc179dc2be67d6

commit_message:
Add configurable handler selection for Deployer

Added to solum-deployer the configuration value 'handler'
to select which one of the available modules in its
handlers directory to use as its endpoint. The result is
being able to configure exactly how images will be deployed.

At present we only have default.py, which uses Heat to deploy
a stack for the app, but in the future there may be other
handlers to use another process.

Since default.py was using Heat, I renamed it to heat.py and
added a new default.py mainly for contract enforcement.

Change-Id: I4c2aefc7d60e421c176bb8e854548486e9d800a3

added_lines: def deploy(self, ctxt, assembly_id, image_id): message = ("Deploy %s %s" % (assembly_id, image_id)) LOG.debug(_("%s") % message)
deleted_lines: import os import time import yaml from oslo.config import cfg from solum.common import clients from solum import objectsSTATES = (PENDING, BUILDING, ERROR, READY, ERROR_STACK_CREATE_FAILED) = ( 'PENDING', 'BUILDING', 'ERROR', 'READY', 'ERROR_STACK_CREATE_FAILED') OPT_GROUP = cfg.OptGroup(name='deployer', title='Options for the solum-deployer service') SERVICE_OPTS = [ cfg.IntOpt('max_attempts', default=400, help=('Number of attempts to query the Heat stack for ' 'finding out the status of the created stack and ' 'getting url of the DU created in the stack')), cfg.IntOpt('wait_interval', default=5, help=('Sleep time interval between two attempts of querying ' 'the Heat stack. This interval is in seconds.')), ] cfg.CONF.register_group(OPT_GROUP) cfg.CONF.register_opts(SERVICE_OPTS, OPT_GROUP) def __init__(self): super(Handler, self).__init__() objects.load() def _get_template(self, template_flavor): proj_dir = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), '..', '..', '..') templ = os.path.join(proj_dir, 'etc', 'solum', 'templates', '%s.yaml' % template_flavor) with open(templ) as templ_file: template = templ_file.read() return template def deploy(self, ctxt, assembly_id, image_id): # TODO(asalkeld) support template flavors (maybe an autoscaling one) # this could also be stored in glance. template_flavor = 'basic' template = self._get_template(template_flavor) osc = clients.OpenStackClients(ctxt) assem = objects.registry.Assembly.get_by_id(ctxt, assembly_id) parameters = {'app_name': assem.name, 'image': image_id} created_stack = osc.heat().stacks.create(stack_name=assem.name, template=template, parameters=parameters) assem.status = BUILDING assem.save(ctxt) stack_id = created_stack['stack']['id'] comp_description = 'Heat Stack %s' % ( yaml.load(template).get('description')) objects.registry.Component.assign_and_create(ctxt, assem, 'Heat Stack', comp_description, created_stack['stack'] ['links'][0]['href']) self._update_assembly_status(ctxt, assem, osc, stack_id) def _update_assembly_status(self, ctxt, assem, osc, stack_id): got_stack_status = False for count in range(cfg.CONF.deployer.max_attempts): stack = osc.heat().stacks.get(stack_id) if stack.status == 'COMPLETE': host_url = self._parse_server_url(stack) if host_url is not None: assem.status = READY assem.application_uri = host_url assem.save(ctxt) got_stack_status = True break elif stack.status == 'FAILED': assem.status = ERROR assem.save(ctxt) got_stack_status = True break time.sleep(cfg.CONF.deployer.wait_interval) if not got_stack_status: assem.status = ERROR_STACK_CREATE_FAILED assem.save(ctxt) def _parse_server_url(self, heat_output): """Parse server url from heat-stack-show output.""" if 'outputs' in heat_output._info: return heat_output._info['outputs'][1]['output_value'] return None

commit_message:
Add a default DeletionPolicy for Fn::ResourceFacade

The provider template can't know whether this is explicitly included in the
facade resource's definition, and shouldn't need to.

Closes-bug: #1299202

Change-Id: I01177a84b86b69e221d83d87f3efd9e07e5b9c1f

commit_message:
Always answer empty list if deployments not ready

An empty deployments will cause json decode exception, and once
deployments=[] coming, it will trigger another refresh. Always answer
empty list when deployments not ready will solve above two issues.

Change-Id: Iaee3a3ef25cf9907aaefd941dcb316ecb25a29d6
Closes-Bug: #1298417

commit_message:
Ensure parameter timeout_mins available in update

The parameter timeout_mins is not available when
updating a stack. The updater gets it from the
old stack no matter whether timeout_mins is
offered or not.

If timeout_mins is not offered in the new stack,
get the timeout from the old stack, and update
this parameter using the new stack's timeout.

Change-Id: I7d04d0f0b7cc917d49d45c0d3e1d5a8ffb7bff0b
Closes-Bug: 1290603

commit_message:
Insertion port id in address attribute of server

Dictionary returned by server's attribute addresses does not contain
port id value. Current patch adds field port in this dictionary.

Change-Id: Ie458e67d976af0dd394c3fa4a6d77bce78161bef
Closes-bug: #1285899

commit_message:
Allow passing auth plugin as a parameter

This further separates the concept of session and auth plugin so that
the session can be a completely standalone transport layer.

This is similar to how requests handles things. You can install an auth
plugin on the session object and then everything that works through the
session will be authenticated or you can specify the auth plugin per
request and only authenticate that request.

Change-Id: If4ed5af831cc35e259d9f963062261819f08a9d5

commit_message:
Add L2 Agent side handling for non consistent security_group settings

Add setting of the firewall_driver to NoopDriver when firewall_driver is None and
add warning if driver combination is not valid.
Modify is_valid_driver_combination to verify default settings: enable_security_group (True) and firewall_driver (None).

Change-Id: I841f9cf96ac6ee2ad17a4e8908d6c8a96f368cca
Closes-Bug: #1296957
(cherry picked from commit 5c6ff449bbd7386f0f3e41efc524024434f325df)

Fix deprecation warning

Accessing BaseException.message spews a warning; we can get the same
information with str(err), which does not spew.

subject: Catch loading failures if transport_url is not set
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-07 08:22:23.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/test_notifier.py', 'glance/notifier.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/69fdd19cf1f780a24c48efa5fc3f317f6b451f9c', 'message': "Catch loading failures if transport_url is not set

The current implementation always tries to get a transport from
oslo.messaging assuming the transport_url option has been set. This is
done to keep backwards compatibility. However, since the default
`rpc_backend` is rabbit, it'll always try to load such driver. The
problem raises when `kombu` is not installed and the `notifier_strategy`
is set to qpid. This will make glance-api fail because it'll try to load
the rabbit driver *before* loading the qpid one.

This patch puts the first load attempt in a try / except block. The
error caught (if any) will be re-raised *just* if transport_url has been
configured, otherwise it'll move forward and try to load the notifier
driver using the old configuration options.

The patch also removes an obsolete test.

Change-Id: I00e653704463ea8245e2960050e0d5e6839f278a
Closes-bug: #1302661
(cherry picked from commit 164d1ab46f06141e2c12b944e15ae10f20dace38)
"}]
commit_message:
Catch loading failures if transport_url is not set

The current implementation always tries to get a transport from
oslo.messaging assuming the transport_url option has been set. This is
done to keep backwards compatibility. However, since the default
`rpc_backend` is rabbit, it'll always try to load such driver. The
problem raises when `kombu` is not installed and the `notifier_strategy`
is set to qpid. This will make glance-api fail because it'll try to load
the rabbit driver *before* loading the qpid one.

This patch puts the first load attempt in a try / except block. The
error caught (if any) will be re-raised *just* if transport_url has been
configured, otherwise it'll move forward and try to load the notifier
driver using the old configuration options.

The patch also removes an obsolete test.

Change-Id: I00e653704463ea8245e2960050e0d5e6839f278a
Closes-bug: #1302661
(cherry picked from commit 164d1ab46f06141e2c12b944e15ae10f20dace38)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/64/85664/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: # NOTE(flaper87): Assume the user has configured # the transport url. self._transport = messaging.get_transport(CONF, aliases=_ALIASES) except messaging.DriverLoadFailure: # NOTE(flaper87): Catch driver load failures and re-raise # them *just* if the `transport_url` option was set. This # step is intended to keep backwards compatibility and avoid # weird behaviors (like exceptions on missing dependencies) # when the old notifier options are used. if CONF.transport_url is not None: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.exception(_('Error loading the notifier'))
deleted_lines: # NOTE(flaper87): Assume the user has configured # the transport url. self._transport = messaging.get_transport(CONF, aliases=_ALIASES)

commit_message:
Remove pep8, pyflakes and flake8 from test-requirements

No need to pin the versions of pep8, pyflakes, and flake8 since they are
already pinned by hacking. This is the same way its done for all other
integrated projects.

Change-Id: I81bcbf73db4e77e459c03d4f0271dd801f40bc4e

commit_message:
Adds TaskStub class

Partial Task patch, Id I4fbadc9a97e3147128c7c733384c7bb50918806f
removed the result and message vars of the Tasks class. However,
the succeed and fail methods were using those to update them
respectively. This patch introduces a new TaskStub class which
enables the PartialTask functionality without looking result
and message attrs of the Task class.

Fixes bug 1284975

Change-Id: I0b406e4662cfd3cb496b71be77ad10a90c178baa

commit_message:
node-list to show the maintenance field

The review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/84685/ added the maintenance
field from nodes to be shown in the GET /nodes. This patchs makes the
necessary changes to the CLI to reflect the changes in Ironic.

Change-Id: Iffb639f1e995ef73a5bda6dd3961a13ba5d865d0
